/wiki/STAR_One:
Star One was an Indian pay television network based in Mumbai. It was launched on 1 November 2004 and it was owned by Star TV and distributed worldwide by Fox International Channels. In November 2006, Star One was launched in the UK on Sky.
 Star One was rebranded as Life OK on 18 December 2011. Its British feed continued broadcasting in the UK and Ireland until 28 May 2012, when it was also rebranded as Star Life OK.
/wiki/C.I.D._(Indian_TV_series):
CID is an Indian police procedural television series about Maharashtra and Mumbai's Crime Investigation Department, created by B. P. Singh for Sony Entertainment Television India. The series starred Shivaji Satam as ACP Pradyuman, Aditya Srivastava and Dayanand Shetty as Senior Inspectors Abhijeet and Daya, Dinesh Phadnis as Inspector Fredricks and Narendra Gupta as forensic expert Dr. Salunkhe.
 The location of the series is set in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. The series premiered on 21 January 1998 and is the longest running television series in India. The last episode aired on 27 October 2018. The series aired its 500th episode on 26 January 2008; 1,000th episode on 27 September 2013 and 1,500th episode on 25 February 2018. The show also re-runs on Sony's sister channel Sony Pal.
/wiki/Sony_TV: Sony Television, Sony TV, or Sony HD may refer to any of the following television-related products from Japanese conglomerate Sony:
/wiki/Raat_Hone_Ko_Hai: Raat Hone Ko Hai is an Indian television horror series that premiered on Sahara Manoranjan on May 10, 2004.
/wiki/Sahara_One: Sahara One was an Indian Hindi general entertainment channel based in New Delhi. It is operated by Sahara India Pariwar.
/wiki/Har_Ghar_Kuch_Kehta_Hai: Har Ghar Kuch Kehta Hai is a Hindi television serial that aired on Zee TV from 16 July 2007 – 18 April 2008. It was based on the story of 3 girls: Prarthna, Sidhhi, and Sanskriti. Even though they all have different lives and a different outlook of life, destiny is not always on their side, and when the unexpected happens their dreams, hopes and desires come crashing down.
/wiki/Zee_TV:
Zee TV is an Indian pay television channel owned by Zee Entertainment Enterprises, a media and entertainment company based in Mumbai, Maharashtra. A part of the Essel Group, it started to broadcast on 2 October 1992 as the first Hindi-language subscription channel in India.
 Zee TV HD was launched on 15 August 2011 along with Zee Cinema HD, Zee Studio HD. It overhauled its old logo on 15 October 2017, along with all other channels of the Zee Entertainment Enterprises.
/wiki/Miley_Jab_Hum_Tum: Miley Jab Hum Tum (When We Met) is an Indian Teen drama television series that aired on STAR One from 22 September 2008 to 19 November 2010. The show is about falling in love during college and developing relations for a lifetime.
/wiki/Hitler_Didi:
Hitler Didi (English: literally Hitler Sister but figuratively Auntie Hitler) is a daily Indian soap opera that aired on Zee TV. It premiered on 7 November 2011. The story is located in the backdrop of Delhi.  It airs in Pakistan on Express Entertainment. It also airs in Persian on Gem Bollywood as same name Hitler Didi.
 The title of the show has been called "disturbing" by the Anti-Defamation League. In some countries, the show is known as General Didi.
/wiki/Begusarai_(TV_series): Begusarai is a daily soap opera that aired from Monday to Friday at 10:00 pm Indian standard time on &TV. The show premiered on 2 March 2015 and ended on 24 June 2016. It starred Shweta Tiwari, Shivangi Joshi, Satraj Gill and Vishal Aditya Singh in lead roles.The show is set in Begusarai, Bihar. The show was produced by Swastik Pictures (Swastik Productions Pvt. Ltd.).
/wiki/&TV: &TV (And TV) is a Hindi language entertainment channel owned by Zee Entertainment Enterprises. Launched as a General Entertainment Channel from ZEEL group, it started broadcasting on 2 March 2015.
/wiki/Porus_(TV_series): Porus is a historical drama television series based on the Battle of the Hydaspes, visualizing the lives of Indian warrior and ruler Porus, King of the Pauravas and Alexander The Great, King of the Macedonian Empire. It premiered on 27 November 2017 on Sony TV. It aired its last episode on 13 November 2018. Another historical drama Chandragupta Maurya replaced it with seamless continuity of story. The show is created by Siddharth Kumar Tewary of Swastik Productions. It is the most expensive show on Indian television, having a budget of about INR 500 crores (roughly USD 70 million). In Sri Lanka, it airs on Sirasa TV, dubbed into Sinhala under the name Digvijaya. The rights to the drama have also been sold to Thailand, Malaysia, Cambodia, Myanmar, Laos, and Vietnam.
/wiki/Nazar_(TV_series):
Nazar (Evil Eye) is an Indian supernatural television series which airs on Star Plus and streams on Hotstar. Produced by Gul Khan and Karishma Jain under 4 Lions Films, it is directed by Atif Khan and written by Mrinal Jha. 
 Season 1, which starred Antara Biswas, Harsh Rajput and Niyati Fatnani, ended on 18 February 2020. Season 2 premiered on 19 February 2020 starring Shruti Sharma and Sheezan Mohammad, while Antara Biswas is seen in a new role.
/wiki/Star_Plus: StarPlus is an Indian pay television channel owned by Star India. The network's programming consists of family dramas, comedies, youth-oriented reality shows, shows on crime and television films. It is also distributed internationally by The Walt Disney Company India, subsidiary of The Walt Disney Company.
/wiki/Divya_Drishti: Divya Drishti is an Indian supernatural drama television series which premiered on 23 February 2019 on Star Plus aired during weekends. Produced under Fireworks Productions, it stars Sana Sayyad, Nyra Banerjee, Sangita Ghosh, Adhvik Mahajan and Mishkat Varma.
/wiki/Tenali_Rama_(TV_series):
Tenali Rama is an Indian historical comedy drama  based on the life of the legendary Telugu poet Tenali Ramakrishna, one of the Ashtadiggajas (or the eight honorable) poets at the court of Vijayanagara Emperor Krishnadevaraya (CE. 1509–1529), who is often cited as the greatest Vijayanagara emperor. The series premiered on SAB TV on 11 July 2017.
 The show took a 9 months leap in July 2018 and then a 5 years leap followed by 20 years leap in August 2019. The series is produced by Abhimanyu Singh under the banner of Contiloe Entertainment and is directed by  T.S. Nagabharana.
/wiki/Sony_Sab: Sony SAB (formerly SAB TV) stylised as SONY SAB is an Indian pay television channel owned by Sony Pictures Networks and specialising in comedy shows and soap operas.
/wiki/Dangal_TV: Dangal (Devanagari: दंगल) is a Hindi language general entertainment channel that broadcast the original programmes along with shows of some popular channels and off late shows. Dangal is the most watched Hindi language channel in U+R category since week 13 of 2019. It is owned by Enterr10 Television Pvt. Ltd. Previously, Dangal was intened to be a Bhojpuri channel only. It topped the TRP charts in Bihar, Jharkhand & Uttar Pradesh in rural areas. Seeing its popularity it turned into general entertainment channel in Hindi. It started its journey with Sagar Picture's Jai Shri Krishna for the first time.
/wiki/Rati_Pandey: Rati Pandey is an Indian actress known for her performances in Porus, Hitler Didi, Miley Jab Hum Tum, Begusarai, Har Ghar Kuch Kehta Hai and Shaadi Street.
